lq8FiegT5xe2lq_P4cyQqA.text: Have you not been here???? If not then what are you doing with your life? This. Place. Rocks. Ok so first of all if your a falafel person then you need to get there now. They make falafel on pita/salad/rice and its tah-die-for!  I cant even count on all my fingers and toes how many times (ok super late nights) my guy and I have dragged our not so sober selves to stand in the what will seem at first to be the longest line that isn't even really a line because drunk people were in charge of forming it so its a complete circus but somehow someway they guide you in take your order and off you go to enjoy your halal cart magic that will simultaneously delight and surprise and leave you wanting more and have no fear my non adult beverage indulging friends I have also had this on a few sober occasions as well and I can soberly attest to it on those days too.  I have also enjoyed the chicken dishes and my guy has raved about the gyros and phillys they offer also. This place radiates flavorful scents better than fast food joints so if you don't believe me just walk by one night on your next trip uptown and check it out for yourself and don't let the "line" scare you away from this little gem.

N4dBnbespAgQmA-KBD4dcw.text: This place is fantastic, cheap prices and great food. I suggest the chicken and lamb combo over rice ($6). if you like it spicy get the hot sauce, if you like it really spicy like I do get extra hot sauce. I eat here once a week and have never been disappointed

XmUGjO49shII_9ze6qHdiQ.text: AMAZING food!!   The best gyro I have had in Charlotte!!  Chicken and Rice platte is great too!  Don't miss this gem.

1rcbgwRiNv9lgDpdK5TL7Q.text: Great food- I personally love the falafel wrap with hot sauce- and super nice employees. Be prepared for a wait if you come during the lunch rush, though!

TU6ulDM9sY9DwCM-tWbQnw.text: This has become a staple for lunch options Uptown.  The food is fantastic and prices are great.  There's almost always a huge line though!

z62_3d_JD1ALwtBkvC5U-g.text: Love this place! It's really cheap, cash only, and pretty quick so makes it good for workday lunch. It makes a great spot for lunch uptown.

I17exUu2KKgTwm72soMgpA.text: Ordered food and paid for it but never got it. These guys are assholes. Wish I could give less than a 1 star

ipDn9sHk5fr9v2JrUDDBKQ.text: Eat at your own risk.  I was excited to see this cart in the university area.  Passed it many times and always wanted to stop there.  Finally did.  Based on the reviews I was excited to get home and see what the fuss was.  Ordered Gyro, Chicken and Lamb Combo, and the falafel salad.  I opened the chicken and Lamb first and didn't see anything mind blowing but had high hopes on the taste.  Excited to see the rest I opened up the falafel salad.  The salad looks to be made with green leaf lettuce mix but then I noticed black marks all over the salad.  I thought maybe they sauteed the salad and thought maybe some of it was charred however that was was not the case.  Upon closer inspection... I noticed that the leaves were brown/black and rotted/spoiled.  It was an appalling sight.  I had to take it back within minutes of getting it home.  I thought maybe there might be some understanding with the establishment but I was wrong.  I got back and showed the salad to the gentleman who took my order/money.  I told him it was rotted/spoiled salad and he had a shocked look when he saw it.  I also asked him if he would eat it and he didn't have a response except scramble to refund me.  Lucky me, the owner was there and the gentleman giving my refund pointed him to me.  I asked to speak to him and the owner came out and said the salad was fine.  He also then claimed that it was balsamic vinegar dressing.  I love balsamic vinegar salads and salads in general so I  have had my fair share of salads.  Ive also made many salads and have handled all types of lettuce/produce and I know what fresh salads/greens look like.  I also know what spoiled/rotting lettuce/produce looks like.  All the black and brown edges and spots were slimy and horribly wilted.  Not to mention the rotted leaves were slimy and quickly fell apart when gently rubbed between the fingers and I mean I did it gently.  Long story short, the owner claimed that his lettuce leaf was predressed with balsamic vinegar.  He then pulled out what looked to be a bulk bag/maybe 10+lbs of lettuce and there was brown juice all over with many leaves that looked horrible.  I could not believe my eyes and his bold claim that it was prepackaged balsamic vinegar salad.  He also said he could open it and allow me to taste it.  The funny thing is when I asked them if they would eat what they served me no one responded.  Maybe I'm clueless but of all the prepackaged salads I've bought, I've never once seen salads that have been predressed in the bag already.  Normally, any supplied dressing comes in a package packed in separately with the greens.  Why would the owner state this when it's a cardinal sin to have/serve soggy salad??  To think that a company would prepackage salad greens that have already been dressed in dressing that could be sitting for days/weeks and then be ok to be served is beyond my little brain.  That said, I would love to see this owner tell food services/the health department what he told me and let them confirm.  This is the first and last time I will visit this establishment.  To those that do... good luck and hopefully you don't order the "predressed" balsamic greens that are rotted/spoiled.  I can not believe this was the exchange/excuse provided from the owner.  I could see a worker but the Owner???  This lack of care/concern is quite disappointing and is clearly reflected in the food that they are willing to put out.  Sadly disappointed as i really wanted to support this establishment because I love this type of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was so unappetizing... rotted greens
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. More spoiled/rotted greens
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. More spoiled/rotted greens

w8RSAjELMzBj29TODaNzdA.text: This place rocks!  Extremely good and it only costs $6.  I always get the Lamb over rice, extra spice. Everyone from our office who has eaten here absolutely loves it.  Definitely needs to be part of everyone's lunch rotation.

NIyR0ubAaU3jxHfvtfC-VA.text: Best meal we had from a food truck till now. The prices are very reasonable yet no compromise in food quality or quantity.. cash only which is not uncommon for many food trucks I guess. They have veggie options and many meat choices. I had a falafel over rice and my friend had chicken and we both liked our food a lot. Would definitely recommend..!!!

VXSABKcbDhjxmrYWu1OOkQ.text: Food is great I always eat here, everyone is cool there besides this one elderly guy always has an attitude every time u ask him a question... he normally work nights! I asked if I could pay with a card and he gave me the craziest look and was very rude. I will not be eating here again! So sad because the food is very good!

CPcbkCUXQmJoL4uhBsRRhw.text: Midnight snack or lunch time food, they have it, and they open long hours especially Thursday - Saturday nights. One issue I have when purchasing plate with salad, they usually put rice instead. Good food though

I1-cHOhG2Uu-7EboyZhYbg.text: After I moved to Charlotte from NYC one of the things I missed the most was Halal street food, so when I rode past this cart one day on my bike I thought at first I must be dreaming. But the smell hits you first, as with all good Halal carts, and when I saw it I immediately pulled over, parked my bike and made an order. The chicken with rice is outstanding, as is the falafel, pita, all of it. All are authentic, flavorful, fresh tasting and well executed. I've been back here several times and could probably eat here every day. Plus, the prices are very cheap -- seven bucks gets you a great meal. Highly recommended!

EKcW_aIkJ0GPHZyKMo8Qdg.text: Awesome Halal food truck! Every time I visit Charlotte I have to grab a quick lunch here. Super cheap and the falafel salad is bomb! The falafel is super flavorful and perfectly battered, and the sauce is delicious. Don't overlook because it's a food cart, definitely a great try!

tMcAyuRNAzrrUFxnYrFbGg.text: OOOHHHWWWEEEEE! I'm in heaven!  $6 makes me holler for some divine lunch!  Coming from a larger well-established city, I REALLY miss food like this.  Everything was flavored beautifully, they made it so quickly and it was super convenient for the few days of the work week I forget to pack a lunch (ok, maybe it's a intentional forgetting).   I like the lamb and chicken combo and I ask for it hot.  And boy oh boy is it hot!  Thank goodness for the creamy saucy stuff (similar to a tzatziki?) to even it out - maybe I'll ask for the hot stuff on the side next time.  No, no I won't - it wonderful just the way it is.  There's vegetarian options and salads available too.  Cash only!

ypG835V93rxtvfEj2Y4txA.text: Delicious food! Cheap prices.  I always order the lamb and chicken combo, extra spicy. Not once have I been disappointed. You are able to walk away for only $6, and the quantity of the food is such that you will not be hungry when you are done.  Why only 4 stars? Well, they need to accept Square payments or something. After all, it's 2017.  I often rave about this place to my friends, with this sound advice as an addendum: Go early to miss the lines, and make sure you bring cash!

7c9JgYlbWcoal4DLYi-1CQ.text: I was on my way to get sushi & was talking to my amazing uber driver about the Bronx & Brooklyn. He had told me how he misses the food from the city & I mentioned to him how I miss chicken & rice from the cart near Rockefeller. He told me about this spot & how it is the best chicken & rice in Charlotte. When he told me about it I immediately changed my trip. When I arrived there the moment I got out I could smell the deliciousness in the air. I placed my order but didn't have cash, the guy taking my order was so nice. He told me he would take my order & pointed me to the nearest ATM which was a min away from the cart (they are brilliant with this location). I paid them & within minutes they had my food ready.   When I got home I felt like a kid with candy. I opened it & fell in love instantly with the food. I wish they had delivery because I would order more right now so I can eat it all day lol!!! The food is amazing & everyone should try it!!!! If you don't like it then there is something wrong with you :)

bYdVWFqyGglABMBVlJCaqQ.text: All the yes... Spicy, savory, smiling goodness. To elaborate a smidge:  The service was prompt, helpful, and friendly.   The food was perfect. I asked for spicy and they delivered. As simple as rice may seem, I almost always struggle with the execution. Not here. I'm still flabbergasted that 'plain' rice can be so satisfying. I'll go again, and I'm only in town for a week.

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

Ux6jhJUYsbCxlnGOzN-YwA.text: Not NY street meat but dam close!! Def worth a trip, open till 1:30am and they do enough business that the food is fresh. White sauce is legit lam is tender chicken is well seasoned

GN4RAmq_M5hnrE3W3470_Q.text: Best lunch ever. Just get the combo - spicy or extra spicy... I got extra spicy today and oh my, that heat. $7 with a drink to handle the fire.  Get there early at lunch or there will be somewhat of a wait. Regardless, it's worth it. It's really just rice, meat and badass spices/sauces (there is a little salad on the side). You'll probably dream about making your own sauces, so you can use it on everything.  I've been told they make a good philly, too.  Cash only

DGEafZc5AMqNObB9sQUUsQ.text: I've eaten here three times in the past week (mainly due to laziness and it's walking distance from my house). It's so good, cheap, and really convenient. I've had the chicken and lamb combo and the philly cheesesteak. The chicken and lamb combo is amazing, it is enough food to share with someone else or can be consumed by one if you're really hungry! The little seeds that is mixed in with the rice adds a little bit of seasoning to the chicken and lamb and the yogurt sauce poured on top of it all makes the meal! There's a little bit of lettuce that's always on the side, it makes me feel like I'm being a little bit healthy by eating it, but the meat and rice take over the entire meal. The philly was good, it is not too big and overly filled with food. Make sure you have cash, because that's all they take!

bgSke9kxOsI7ROhLE_Vk0w.text: Great option for lunch uptown. My go to is the chicken over rice. A huge portion of deliciousness for only $6. Don't let the line scare you off - they move fast!

FN8ZTCjuSSvf0bmQwQQY-A.text: I love Mediterranean food and this place was really good. Close to the Uptown, I try to buy food here after I finish my evening classes. This place always keeps me excited. Really worth the $6.

Sif16lmi6WDWCYqEw5uZ6g.text: For $6 you can have the most delicious and fulfilling lamb over rice or chicken/lamb over rice . . . or the best Philly cheese steak in the city. You pick. And if you like your food spicy, ask for the house hot sauce. No need to blow a hole in your wallet; grab a meal at Mi Barrio and enjoy it at any of the outdoor seating areas or parks. Cash only.

O7UEo5ziADxu6H2LlzNZqQ.text: There was a nice guy that used to run this cart. One day he was gone.  The rice isn't the same and overall spirit is gone. . The new older guy seems so rude, he acts as if you aren't standing there. Won't be back,  but ill go to the one in University

sS-9SFVX6XfFXrRQGP3u5g.text: It's cash only but worth every cent, been eating here at least once a week for the past two years.  Friendly staff, sometimes there is a bit of a wait time but so worth the wait!

kz1ERAxQo2tODdWzbJW1kA.text: Great falafel on pita!  Extra tzatiki given at no charge. Cheap and delicious, grateful they are open Sunday afternoon on a game day.

YF1K9mRPTJOSFBH5QbRs8A.text: Awesome food. Very quick and very easy. And you get plenty of food for the price. I've been to NY plenty of times and they've captured the concept to perfection.

Ba0pW6RhW2GJYDrLkmii-g.text: This place is really good.  Open late, awesome food.  We got the lamb and chicken dish, and the falafel.  Will go back again if I am in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Open late

DNG6ZKYHWN_KLG5htEl_5Q.text: Probably the best lunch in Uptown. This place is the real deal. Reminds me of the halal carts in NYC, and their food is just as good, if not better. The lamb and chicken over rice is delicious. The gyro and chicken pitas are amazing as well.  Make sure you try the yogurt sauce and the hot sauce they offer. They're usually pretty busy during lunch hours, but it's worth the wait. Only negative is they only accept cash.

DZwPfEMY0qTc2T71lD2Lpw.text: Speaking from an Arabic view, it is the best you will find. Probably the best falafel I've had outside of the Middle East.

QNSTKJedujFJcfOAPtzing.text: I'm so done with the Halal truck!! First time was great! Next couple of times, they covered my food in yogurt sauce. I'm talking about just straight poured it on where there was a good 1/2 inch puddle at the bottom of my food. Next time I asked for the yogurt sauce to be on the side since they drenched it and he POURED DIABLO sauce all over my food. Stuff is so freaking hot you can't even eat it. Never again!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Never again!! My lamb chicken salad was covered in diablo sauce, after I asked for sauce on the side!!

bfzBssJXG9XW3vVaYqb3MA.text: Amazing food  Very affordable.. Lamb over rice  Chicken gyro are a few of my favorite.  Love location, especially the one off university city blvd. Only disadvantage is you need to carry cash  They don't accept cards.

PUbHQvcuz_WKNqAV-vMpNw.text: Best in Charlotte!! I first had Halal food in NYC about 5-6 years ago. Ever since then, I've been searching locally for that same taste...to no avail, until late 2016...around July. I tried this cart after a meeting uptown, and it absolutely reminds me of NYC Halal food! Sooooo good! I kept forgetting to write a review, so now I've finally done it lol....but seriously, go get it! You will not be disappointed! The pics are after I mixed it all up....sorry, forgot to take a pic first! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States

aEJ1VmM_4gKWH3BKj9FImg.text: Be careful going there (its addicting) lol its honestly the best deal in town and once you try it hard not to go back multiple times within a short span of time. I thought it was just me but apparently many people have had the same experience!

B5Cb42SO40HOERUdaKCu6g.text: One of the best food options in Uptown as well as the cheapest.   I love their chicken over rice combo and the cheesesteak is solid as well.   I am a fan of the NYC based Halal Guys, but this blows that out of the water.

dA849dA_XiScAIQX2J4kfg.text: So I've tried halal guys in San Fran and in NYC, and will have to say this location pales a little in comparison. Their portions are still huge and tasty but I feel like the meat isn't as good as the big city versions. Overall I love the concept and this location executes it well enough. Plus it's a great late night food option! I always order the chicken and lamb combo with the sauces. The hot sauce is pretty spicy though so use with caution!

KPdg2saId1QvcEmUzWa7FQ.text: Was in Charlotte a few days & was starving around midnight with nothing else open nearby. Having grown up in northern NJ, I was kind of skeptical of the halal cart having been to Halal Guys in Manhattan several times. In my mind, no one can beat their white sauce!!! Well...then came halal cart, Charlotte of all places!! I feel like I'm betraying NYC by saying this but I'm a foodie & have to be honest...Halal Cart wins! I had their gyro, lamb & chicken combo, & the next morning before heading to the airport I NEEDED another!! Sadly, I now live in the DC area, & I'm craving one now but nothing comes close here!! Can you guys PLEASE open a cart somewhere here!!?? Amazing.

qFYkmKloX2EY57fcvHf1-w.text: I get the chicken and lamb combo (spicy).  I eat here about once a week and the food is always on point!  Great portion size for $6.00!  There is always a line but it is absolutely worth waiting in line.

wd3imV8x61aOFDNxvapeAQ.text: We were two couples in town for a concert. We got hungry really late and could not locate an open restaurant close to the hotel. The valet attendant recommended this food truck. It's a few blocks from SpringHill Suites. We ordered a burger, philly cheese steak, and wings with fries and onion rings. The burger and cheesesteak helped fend off the hunger and were not horrible, but definitely could use some tweaking. The wings were delicious. The guys running this cart are super friendly and happy to help you. I felt bad for them because in waiting for our food, we observed a lot of people being jerks towards them. They handled it with class. Always smiling. We will definitely hit this truck up again when we have those midnight cravings while downtown.

6SNeZanEev6EG1uBREKidg.text: Brings back the good ole days when I used to hit up Halal Guys by East Village in NYC.  Cheap. Quick. Simple. Friggin Delicious.  Now that I am closer to Uptown, I come here at least once a week for their chicken and lamb combo over rice.  Here are the downsides...the small "salad" that typically comes with each combo is way too little to counterbalance the piles of savory protein they stack on top of your rice. Secondly, good luck with parking. Thirdly, CASH ONLY.  Now the good news is that they have a sister restaurant around Matthews that accepts credit cards, has unlimited parking, and offers huge ass portions for under 7 bucks!

J52yUXq7ErZ7ITEIFbYbdQ.text: Great food.  Usually wait until 130 or 2pm for lunch to avoid the long lines.  They seem to move through it pretty quick though.  Great prices with lots of good.  I've had the lamb and chickem rice combo and the chicken and lamb gyro.  Everything has been wonderful.

Ee-Y358dQ228mXX7pbrHpA.text: Great flavor and great price. I was pleasantly surprised how good the food was for the price. If you have ever been to Halal Guys in NYC this is almost on the same level. The combo chicken/lamb over rice with salad is the way to go. Great place to pick up lunch and they're even in Uptown on the weekends!

20y9ChM501RE2NDScbNwPg.text: I went to get convenient and tasty halal food, not to be yelled at. I specifically said no spicy when ordering, only to be reprimanded when I found out they put spicy sauce all over (I was the only one ordering at 6:30pm on this Monday night). According to them their normal is non-spicy, and any mention of the word "spice" would lead them to think I requested spicy. This was not the normal lunch crew and the food is still good, but a huge blow for not having done anything wrong as a customer.

hcmCEQRwuqeXRfiObappAg.text: I would give the food four stars but a guy in front of me ordered the "hezbollah special" and the guy at the counter was like yeah I got you. I take that personally, I have served several tours in the Middle East and understand hezbollah as the terrorist organization that it is, I refuse to patronize any business that humors hezbollah and the terror it supports.

Dum9dShD3nXIzh8OLCZeTQ.text: We stopped here while walking around downtown charlotte with our dogs. We needed a quick place to eat at outside before heading home. The food was quick and delicious. I had the lamb over rice which was great and my girlfriend had the falafel on pita. Hers had a great spicy sauce that was flavorful and not overly spicy. There was also an amazing street singer nearby.

SHKdQdYCvT009CfmHaoijQ.text: Good food made to order.   Cheap.  I had chicken and rice with extra sauce and chicken.    Banging.    I ate there several times.   Really good stuff. The area is kind of annoying.  Get your food and get back in the car    Def get it to go.   Otherwise you'll have about 27 ppl hit you up for $1 if you can get past that I'd def recommend checking them out for a late night snack

Bz4O4opkopb1Rz55xEQjog.text: This is food cart is one of a kind. I missed the halal guys cart in New York City only to find out that we have our own CLT version. I had lamb over rice and it was the bomb!!

WXWSKHm8414HuYuU__7X3w.text: Was I hungry? Of course... Happy to see this food truck? Absolutely!!! Having heard so much about this place, I finally got to enjoy. Reminds me of some places in the NE. Now what we need, are a few more Halal trucks, dispersed around Charlotte!

xrf_3CwodvqEMIP7bSUtAw.text: I got the chicken over rice meal, and it was a decently sized portion. The flavors were really good, and if you like more spice, be sure to pour a ton of it on your food before you leave the stand. There was a huge chicken to rice ratio, making it way worth the $6. Call me crazy but I almost wish there was a bit more salad on the side to cleanse my palate and add some refreshing crunch to it. Still pretty damn delicious though. I couldn't finish my plate, ended up making a great lunch for the next day.

n13zpw2wXZiTIXB7i6TmUg.text: It's no Halal guys...and it's funny how the line system is set up here. You will know when you stop by and inevitably will get confused. So to save you time during your short lunch break just go straight to the register and ignore everything else around you. Afterwards stand where ever you like until they yell out your name. Trust me this is the best way to deal with the random lines at this food truck. Food wise...I got chicken n' rice and it was pretty good. Too much sauce for my taste lol I can't believe I am saying that but there was. Note if desi get it spicy don't even ask just say spicy.

mRMHzXFalGd8wst9qqDhxw.text: I have driven and walked past this cart a thousand times, and I can't believe as a Charlotte native I just tried this for the first time ever last night. Best falafel pita I've ever had in my entire life. Hands down. Crack pita. $6 and FIRE hot sauce!! I wish I could buy a bottle of it.

OLR5G-DyOjj3xmUwd8oGWg.text: Most awesome food at the most awesome price at almost any time of the day. The lamb over rice is one of my favorites.  The spicy sauce is the cherry on the cake :)

WxJOxl44nmAt-eqQl4NXWQ.text: Like it's sister cart in the University area, this Mi Barrio location offers a delicious assortment of meat over rice and meat on pita dishes, with the chicken and lamb over rice being my favorite. This location is slightly superior in my opinion as the people running this cart always seem to be on point with making sure your order is correct. The food is the star though. It's just so damn good. The seasoning is always on point, the meats are super tender and the rice is well cooked. The portion size is super generous too given that most dishes are only $6. A little bit of the spicy red sauce on top and maybe some pita on the side and you have a splendid meal on your hands. If you're hungry and in uptown, stop on by!

ajZo5OvhxiVm8N8K_i7I3g.text: Not sure what else I can add to so many good reviews. I'll just say Yay! I'm a fan! Quick, easy and cheap. If I was uptown, I would definitely go for it again.

qCi-NgvwanLQUwLrOUPmUw.text: Fast, convenient and reasonable. I normally get the combo; lamb and chicken over rice.  Most of the guys I've met are friendly and the food is done pretty quickly.  They only take cash though! The combo is $6 and everything else is around that price.  The have cans of soda for a $1.  They have a really spicy sauce, available upon request.

O8Tt4yYbsjPaNCM5JkP1Nw.text: Thank you halal cart for being open late!  It's definitely slim pickins in this area for late eats so when you come to town late at night look no farther.  Luckily this cart was also around the corner from my hotel!  I went with the traditional combo, lamb and chicken over rice and wasn't sure what to expect having eaten my fair share of halal carts in NYC.  I quickly took this delight back to my room as the area was a little sketch and devoured my meal.  The combo was honestly better than most of the ones I've had in NYC if not better, watch out halal guys. The meat was finely chopped and well seasoned over nicely cooked basmati rice.  And the kicker was the white sauce, not sure what was on there but wow the flavor was on point, well balanced and perfect compliment to the dish, just wish I had more!  Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States

GjTlHS0UL4-gpk9qmcmMBw.text: Came in late for a business trip and asked my Uber driver for suggestions around the hotel.   He recommended this cart and it was a no brainer.   $7 for a rice combo and a bottled water.   Perfect dinner after a long flight.

SVtxNEP-XkqOAEr5isqbPw.text: BEST halal food I've ever had. The red sauce is so spicy and tasty. The chicken is marinated perfectly! Only reason it's not 5 stars is cause the workers are rude sometimes, but the food is fire!

hxx_--ANrzzKiq-FvoUPBQ.text: What a freaking gem. I can't believe I only have come to this cart once since living in Charlotte! We were parked in the garage near Spectrum Center and got blocked in after a Hornets game. We figured "why not just try it out?" Best. Decision. Ever.   I ordered the Chicken plate and the husband ordered the Chicken and Lamb combo. So much food for $12!!! We asked for the hot sauce on the side and I'm so glad we did. It has quite a kick (and I love spicy food). The white sauce they use is delicious, the guys working were super friendly, and we waited for our hot, fresh food for about 5 minutes.   Life is good with this Halal Cart in my life.

6dybD--FdyeTUsCuNGVOPQ.text: Dont go to the other cart at 400 South Tryon these guys own.  Wildly inconsistent with the food.  Please fire your new crew there, they are horrible.  Bones in the food, pouring silly amounts of the white sauce on the food.

gPZVHoyPvRlNlDeP3a-wQA.text: Very inexpensive and convenient for anyone working in uptown. Just be forewarned that there is always a line! It's so good and worth the wait. You get a lot of food for $6. Drinks are a $1. I got the chicken and lamb combo (spicy).

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States

-kgNQDQk_VLBL-3FY4i_yg.text: Run don't walk.  You really have an experience when you eat here.  This is a cash only place and that is the biggest drawback.  I really wish they would accept credit cards.  The food is simple and delicious.  The portions are generous enough.  The menu isn't diverse but what they offer they are excellent at.  I usually go for lamb and rice or the gyro.  The food is on the fatty side but I just can't get enough of it.  There is a bit of a wait, even during the sub freezing temperatures of late.  If you are in uptown this is a must stop location.  This attraction serves better food that the satellite location near UNC Charlotte.  My favorite is the lamb over rice, I am thinking about having them just put the lamb over lettuce instead.  The lamb over rice isn't a rice version of the lamb salad, but it shares a lot of flavors with the lamb gyro.  My second favorite is the lamb gyro, and this item also satisfies people who can't stand any spice (lamb over rice is a dish best served spicy).  I had the Philly cheese-steak because I wanted a point of comparison for other establishments.  The cheese-steak is alright but suffers from being smaller than the lamb over rice and costing just as much.  I also had a problem where the cheese was stuck to the wrapper and I lost some of it as a result.  See the picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. This gives you the moderate size of the Philly cheese steak.  The cheese is also stuck to the wrapper.

_eckIqF1ts9puaeccXxXeQ.text: Great service !!!!! Amazing and friendly staff. Will definitely come back. Yummy food!

PZYUb2FquWnnyYGZoaL5iw.text: I've lived in the Charlotte area my whole life, how is it I'm just getting around to trying this??   Work took me to the Omni Hotel so I finally decided to try this truck for lunch. The first thing that gets you is the delicious smell from at least a block away. I got the Chicken/Lamb combo: $6 gets you a big scoop of chicken, big scoop of Lamb, two big scoops of rice, lettuce, tomato, a tangy/creamy white sauce, and hot sauce. There was at least a 1/2lb of rice! Food was perfectly seasoned, rice, Lamb, and chicken was cooked great! I went light with the hot sauce this first time but next time I'll go how it comes, the sauce has a lot of flavor and isn't just 'in your face' spicy. Outstanding value and flavor, I'll definitely be back for more!   Notice: Cash only, but the prices on the menu is the final price, tax included in price!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken/Lamb combo = My lunch 2-3 times a week. Always fresh and always delicious!
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Lamb Combo, tangy/creamy white sauce, spicy sauce, lettuce, tomato, rice!

fGV8d5j29Y9SKaegwWkGRA.text: The best halal I've ever had. Everything is so freaking great about the food. Chicken is cooked to perfection and the rice is not too hard or soft, always always always cooked perfectly. The hot sauce is the bomb, the young man wearing a Yankees hat is very very helpful and kind. If this food isn't good, then someone tell me where to find the next best chicken over rice.  Ps- I went specifically downtown to eat here, that's how good it is.

SI7btfDw4A0mf7Qf-1tJtA.text: Chicken over rice is amazing! For only $6 too, can't beat that! Great flavor on the chicken and rice and omg the white sauce is to die for! Love the NYC vibe in downtown Charlotte!!

7PPgZWxKXsTXbjLkHAvHGA.text: amazingggg chicken and lamb over rice!!! great for after the club and don't want to be too full. 5/5

LO_V-ybi3mIvo6a884ic8w.text: I loved this food so much!!!!! Make sure you get the white sauce, hot sauce and pita on the side, it's amazing. Thank me later lol

zjhCxOesDOfm-UdrGDiGhQ.text: I've passed this Halal Cart several times and every time I get a bit giddy and have been dying to try it. Halal food was a staple in my post night out diet in NYC so I was excited to see one in Uptown Charlotte. Here's the run down ...    Payment: Cash Only! C.R.E.A.M. Dolla Dolla Bills Y'all. #WuTang  Location: (5/5) Uptown on Tryon and Trade aka super convenient from any of the bars, clubs or the Epicentre  Quality: (5/5) Fresh and tasty plus I didn't get sick in the morning. You roll the dice anytime to visit a new cart in NYC  Convenience: (6/5) Went here on a Sunday night at 10:30pm! I hard to find decent food at this time  Value: (4.5/5) The various plates and meals run around $6. It's a decent amount of food but it won't feed two people or completely full you if you're hangry. NYC portions are definitely bigger and come with some pita bread on top and cost around $5-7.   My go to order: Lamb & Chicken combo. Spicy. White Sauce. ($6)  To-Dine. Yay or Nay: Definitely Yay. Especially after a night out, it's a super yay!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Combo Plate

hiMDSy7xKrbQ9vEWjFbXow.text: This food cart is DELICIOUS!  It was a life saver last night in uptown.  Their chicken philly hit the spot and was very fresh.  Next time I will try the gyros or rice plates.  They take cash only, that's the only bummer...but other than that we will most definitely stop by again.

7cTIkSrhhz1oaqAkQVcdqQ.text: Really fantastic NY-style Halal Food Cart. We'd passed it all the time, smelling the delicious smells and watching a steady stream of customers at all hours. Today we finally had the chance to try it for ourselves. Great prices, especially on combo (chicken & lamb) over rice. Very filling and fantastic flavor! Gyro was good flavor but not nearly as filling as the rice box for the same price. Either way, I'd happily eat here again anytime I need a quick bite in uptown. (Cash only btw, and if you want change back, you have to ask...)

8Zk5beyJFdAfrwRszuvMMA.text: I would give this place 5 stars but I don't appreciate getting ripped off. I always order the chicken over rice at their main location off E. Independence and would get a box full of food & a drink for ~$7. The cart is only half the size and if "they're limited", they charge DOUBLE the price. Why? Why not be consistent with pricing? They're already giving you half of what you would get at the main location but having to pay double the price is ridiculous. If you want to get your money's worth then go to their main location for better portion size (and for the same price as the cart).

8RyXBD5bQrw9tWt6LIxe8g.text: I've been waiting to come here forEVER, but I either always forget or I never have cash. THIS IS A CASH ONLY SPOT! Just wanted to put that out there to help anyone avoid disappointment.  My friend treated me to the chicken because I don't eat red meat. I told her I wanted extra sauce on the side because you know lots of times, places are a little stingy with the sauce and when you add rice into the equation, it soaks up the sauce and then your food is dry. She assured me that extra sauce wouldn't be needed. I trusted her and she was correct!  I ate that food so fast! I promise I didn't put my fork down once. I was honestly a little sad when I finished. Next time I go, I'm getting TWO orders. This is such a gem to Charlotte and it did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States

6lGEyZojvAKAEw61AA7VDw.text: Food Truck to the rescue!!! Whenever I'm in need of a good cheap lunch while downtown I go to the Halal Food Truck.   I always get the lamb and chicken combo with spicy sauce. I'm not sure what it is but there has to be crack in the food cause it's addictive. The tangy white sauce mixed with the red sauce and with the finely chopped meat over the rice is mind blowing.   If you don't get in line early you will have a wait. They only accept cash and the girl taking orders is very frank. It's just her personality. They get your order placed and your food to you in a timely orderly fashion.   I think the quality and flavor of their food is better than some restaurants in the area. Also you can't find a more filling meal for that price downtown.   Mi Barrio's Halal Cart  101 N Tryon St,  Charlotte, NC 28202

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb and chicken combo
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb and chicken combo with spicy sauce
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb and chicken combo with spicy sauce

_ytZ5eE6jdKBcPULNIj6JQ.text: I needed someplace I could grab some lunch quickly and return to a meeting. I was told that there was a good food truck in the area and decided to look for it on Yelp.   My search led me to one truck, but the number of views were low, so I kept searching and found this spot.   I arrived just on time with only 2 people in line ahead of me.   Here's the process: 1. Check the picture on the truck for you want  2. You'll find a friendly lady taking your cash only orders to the right of the truck  3. Pay and give your name and wait to be called  4. Turn around and see the 15 or more people waiting too  5. Grab your soda from the cooler for a $1  This spot gets nothing but love!! There was a large crowd of folks waiting however the turn around was impressively quick!  Awesome  food, inexpensive $6-$8.00 and GREAT portions!!   And before I forget, my food was DELICIOUS

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Falafel Salad

f4JFB5dPKLfUyCB1Qm7aDQ.text: I'm not really an uptown person, but found myself there hungry and broke....checked Yelp and this cart had Rave reviews. Decided to try something new and was not disappointed. Husband asked for additional spice and was satisfied. My chicken was diced so fine, looked like ground beef,  reason for 4 stars. The guys in the truck/cart were engaging. Thanks for your recommendation, KMac!

mdwKWfJX4x7g9dFNyL-JTw.text: My tia, sister, and nephew came down from Cali in April to visit and found this food truck by The Square. Yes, review long overdue, but still remember how good this place was. I ordered the Chicken Gyro and wow, it was delicious! Their customer service was surprisingly good too. We got in line during lunch time and the line was long. I thought we were going to wait a while , but we didn't. They were so incredibly nice to us especially to my tia and nephew.  And I wish I could have another Chicken Gyro right now...

GR0_F_Cvc_d9YYZ1DbG7qA.text: OMG!!!!! It was good and very reasonably priced. I had it with extra sauce and extra hot and it came out great. I'm going back tomorrow again to get the same thing.

iIhM-kAFmrZ8oj0ocKGJvw.text: I have passed by here many times and it always smells amazing! There is always a line during the lunch rush too!  I am a skeptic but Today I decided to try it and it did not disappoint! Chicken and rice was very yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States

xr8L4O2snND7o2_Qr4rmtg.text: Came here a couple of times for lunch. The line is always super long but it moves relatively quickly. Expect a line of 10 ahead of you to be cleared within 5-7 minutes, but that's just for ordering and paying. Then you have to wait to get your food. That take a a bit longer. Usually, it's about a 10 minute wait for the food.   I always order chicken over rice. It's what I've always ordered at halal trucks in new York. So, was super excited to find this really popular place. The first time I ordered, I got the wrong order... Someone must have ended up with mine too. I ended up with falafel and rice but it was pretty good and the sauces were on point and I didn't have time to go back so. I just ate it.  But now I always check to make sure I got the right order.   Their rice is on point,  their sauces are on point,   and their chicken is good.  It's chopped up so much,  it looks a little like cat food to me,  but that hasn't been a huge detterrant so far.    The chicken over rice is 6$. Pretty solid for what you're paying for and pretty good even when comparing to the NYC halal carts I used to frequent.

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken over rice white sauce hot sauce

xGYQYbay2z2bCYd5Q0sTOw.text: I really just f'ing love these guys. Their lamb (or chicken) over rice with the hot sauce on the side is A. Super flavorful and delicious B. A lot of food and C. Cheap. Doesn't get much better than that.   $6 cash only for lamb over rice - also served with a little iceberg lettuce and some kind of amazing white sauce.

AtXMeUtRbFNQC4972XiUUw.text: Delicious NY Style halal cart food that comes in massive potions at an incredibly cheap price (seriously, $6 for a plate of lamb and chicken over rice and salad with white and red sauce WITH a drink is unbeatable). The service is very friendly and fast and the food always comes out superb.  The lines can get super long around lunch (12:00) so bear that in mind.   Definitely recommend stopping for a quick lunch, as long as you're sharing or starving!

6PkPQB0MfpSHCjAX75S1Cw.text: Oh.My.Gosh This place is the real deal!!! I work in Uptown Charlotte and have been wanting to check out this food truck for a while. It's parked at Trade and Tryon.   First off, it is CASH ONLY. There is typically a one but it moves quickly.   I went with the chicken and lamb combo. Minced chicken and lamb over rice with some lettuce covered in a white sauce. Even better then it sounds. Tons of food and absolutely delish! They definitely didn't skimp on rice or meat!  This food cart is absolutely going to be a regular lunch time spot for me!

hEGltq2V6GFoNrBdTnqVgw.text: Management sucks. Very rude and very greedy with little hot sauce for some reason. As if it significantly effects margins?? Ordered a spicy gyro and was not spicy nor came with sauce many times I've gone. Gotta make the customers happy...

I4Yn21j7Uto1vE6ZFGaWQA.text: Your standard halal food cart. No idea how this is remotely latin. It is a straighr copy of NY and the burrow's street carts. Not the best and not the worst. The cash only part makes them lose a star, definately skimming on the tax bill and super inconvenient in 2019

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States

i4mESBVv5_JFR1l7Nn_DKQ.text: Omg, what an amazing treat. When I first saw the cart, I thought, "is that the cart I've been reading about?"  So my wife and I went to a concert, and in the middle of an amazing show, I look at my yelp app to see what time the cart closes. The answer? 4am! So my dancing and singing was amplified knowing I was going to have some food afterwards.  After the show we hustle over to the cart and order a falafel salad and their combination plate of chicken and lamb. The food was prepared super quick at the cost of $11.  When my wife and I got home, we tore into our meals. The taste was fantastic. I couldn't have been happier. The look of the dishes wasn't something you'd see in bon appetit magazine, but boy was it good.   Would I recommend? Absolutely yes! Great food, ample portion and cheap prices. Who could ask for anything more?

5trPp9IMTE9lxdpx64v9uw.text: This place is truly a Charlotte gem! They have quick service and the food is amazing for such a low price. I tend to get the same things (lamb and/or chicken over rice) but I've heard the cheesesteaks and gyros are good too. It's worth the trek uptown at anytime as they stay open until 4am just about every night. If you haven't stopped in def do so, best $6 spent ever!

photos.caption: Photo of Halal Food Cart - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb and chicken over rice

MGxoowbiPQnSwLdY-TBc_g.text: CASH ONLY! Meat over rice is $6 flat; drinks are $1 flat.  I love this place with my whole heart. It's just delicious. The most popular meal is probably lamb and chicken over rice, but I prefer just chicken over rice. It comes with a tiny bit of lettuce and a white sauce over everything. I ask for spicy sauce on the side - it's pretty hot.   It's my favorite lunch. I eat here at least once a week and I crave it constantly. I dream of Halal. Seriously, go eat here ASAP.

rOd5i7OomdQ27jkwuZkE-A.text: Yes!  A chicken and lamb combo over rice with a side salad for $6?  Not only is the deal amazing, the food is tasty, too.  I asked for the spicy sauce, which gave the right amount of kick to it all.  My friends and I stopped by the cart on the way to a Panthers game - great location, great price.  Service was quick, too.    A few minor downsides: 1. It's a cart, so we had to sit outside, and it was rather cold that day. 2. Its sanitation grade was an 86.  I didn't get sick after the meal, though... but if that's enough to prevent you from going, you've now been warned. 3. It's cash only, but that's not a big deal to me. 4. Parking - we were walking to the game anyway, so it wasn't an issue, but I could see it being a problem if we went just to eat there.  I don't think the parking is all that easy to find around there.  If you're in the uptown Charlotte area, make sure to stop by this halal cart.  Get the chicken and lamb combo over rice and you won't regret it.  I will be sure to be back.

sJWuAFWt7xW4t9Zosr1LHQ.text: Consistent! Hot! Great!  I always get the 'combo over rice' and the spice on the side. I can say that without a doubt some of the best food I've had from a food cart. No matter if it's 2am or 2pm. It's the same great tasting food and friendly staff. If there's a line, trust me wait!! it's worth all that time and a lot better for you. I'll always return and I will always bring my friends.

Jy4Wo5O4q4DvK4WxducXlw.text: When in doubt, go halal (cart). As far as lunch options in Uptown go, you won't find anything that is as simultaneously tasty, filling and cheap. I've never deviated from ordering the chicken over rice, lamb over rice or the combo, nor have I found any reason to. The line may seem to be long during the lunch rush, but they run an efficient operation and the wait is never too bad.  My main qualm is that they only take cash, like seemingly every other halal cart in America. At least they keep the prices cheap.

Pc-Rddu-7MDsT4mv0uQDow.text: A little heavy on the sauce, but delicious all the same and the perfect late night snack. At only $6 for a box of chicken & rice, it's hard to have any complaints! My friends also love the gyros here, but my go-to is chicken & gyro meat over rice, with some red sauce on the side.
